comments.body: Mystic Quartz
i think this would be agreat idea.
In survival mode would be great too!
Can you add rainbow bed on your feedback?
I‚Äôm Rainbowed
It does 1 extra damage more than netherite.

@Blast Burner
I think that it should be in the blocks section, because it‚Äôs about the diamond ore

I agree. We already have emeralds only being found in extreme hills, and gold being more common in mesas. I think having diamond being more common in savannahs would be a great (and realistic) addition to the game. Savannas are also confirmed as getting an update, so it would make sense that if this was done, it would be with that update. There isn‚Äôt really anything in savanna‚Äôs right now other than villages and the acacia trees, so this would be a wonderful incentive to travel there.

I have to say the pine forest. One day I just dug a hole and went down started mining, with no caves found, and before I knew it I had 30 diamonds. No enchanted pick either.. it seemed ever 20 blocks I was finding ore. I got greedy and left to go get my pick axe fortune 3 and couldnt find my hole again.. I will go and try the Savannah bio, and compare.
Additional diamond ore should appear on the savannah biome chucks, but on a Netherite basis. It would be smaller than the main ore and never show up exposed.
I second this. Super obvious crafting recipe too: just the same recipe as regular Nether Brick Fence but with four Red Nether Brick blocks instead.
This would be so useful in building in general.
Honestly I don't care about the new things they are adding. as long as I get my red nether brick fence, I am happy.
Maybe this should just be a part of the respiration helmet enchantment
Oh, that makes a lot more sense. You should make it to where a respiration helmet helps the player see under lava. You came up with it and I won't take it.

A wonderful idea! To make things more convenient I thought of the same thing, however instead of night vision + magma cream, how about crimson fungi, they are less useful than their sibling warped fungi

It would be better if it was called lava vision potion,because it was brewed from the night vision potion.As it was brewed from the night vision potion,it only made sense that the potion that came from it also had the word vision,not sight,or else it might sound weird.Fire should be replaced with lava as the purpose of this potion is supposed to let you see under lava,thus the potion should be called lava vision potion.
Possibly, just like night vision, it could be brewed by a fire resistance potion, then a golden carrot?

I really like this idea. I think it will revolutionize lava biomes by making people be able to see in them, while swimming by using the fire resistance potion. It could pave the way towards specialty lava biomes, like how there's special water biomes, except this could be much more interesting, with different ways of developing it and not being confined to what it is in reality (like how the water biomes have to imitate real water biomes). It could make creatures like a lava version of a Drowned (maybe a Burned or a Scald? I might suggest this in a different post), plus different lava neutral mobs, like a lava fish. It could make specific lava biomes, like maybe plants that live under lava, special ores and rock under lava that could lead to further potions or armor/tools/weapons with special abilities, and even possibly volcanos (even if they don't erupt). Specifically, these things could be ultra-special, seeing as how it would be hard to get both potions so you can operate under lava, making these resources very coveted. All this needs a potion like a lava vision, though. As of now, you can't see a thing while in lava, which would render all this useless, if it happens.

I wouldn't change anything about this, except maybe that instead of Magma Cream, it could be made with something more special, like a blaze rod or a Crimson Fungi, as suggested earlier. Magma Cream is already used in another potion.
Definitely! I would also vouch for the key-bind: Press Q twice successively, or hold down Q for a certain amount of time.
Great idea. This will make killing monsters more fun
Good idea I have trouble chopping wood!

Two things.

1) It's very annoying to have to scroll through your table of contents before actually getting to read your idea. I advise you to change that.

2) You've just proposed a new item that requires a Golden Apple as an ingredient, but gives you the effects for a shorter amount of time. Why would anyone make this if they can get a better result by just eating the Golden Apple?? You need to rethink this idea.
What what makes this better than normal bread?
Yeah this could be use for map maker when they build futuristic/modern location and the sign is a little bit out of place

Yes i like iron

üòÅüòÖüòÖ

Boom
U Da best
Yeah like for when you need a modern look and you have the extra iron.
Very good morning please find attached the following link and follow us
Now that glowing ink is a thing, Iron Sings makes way more sense. Besides, I want a non flammable sign. Even Stone Signs are OK
With the new font: "illageralt" coming in 1.18, I think that the iron sign should have the font to: "illageralt" as default. I also thought the stick used for the iron sign recipe should be a bone.
I love this idea, would be really cool to have a iron (white) sign with black text!! Contrasting would make it easier to read :)
Looks like a really cool idea to me! Good for adventure maps as well!
Cool idea, why don't you comment this in ladder variants or something to get more chance of getting added.

I have heard several ideas about player agency when it comes to the whether, and I really like how this one stays in line with an idea that is already in the game being the clock/compass "genre" of items. Also, I completely agree with the offhand comment about more to weather. If there were an entire update about weather/climate called the "seasons" update, (or something like that) it would be amazing.
I would love this to be in game.

Good idea.

I hate to wait AFK for thunderstorms so I can farm charged creepers with Trident. If I had a way to determine what the weather will be in foreseeable future (like a day), I can just go about my business without being afraid to miss the thunderstorm away from my base/farm.

Now that copper and amethyst are introduced and they honestly have little use right now, it will be a good idea to use them to craft weather predictor. Especially given that they already have some environment-oriented purposes - crafting lightning rod and spyglass. IMHO, this will be in line developer's vision for these materials.

But I think that weather predictor should be a block, not a tool. In the ancient times people predicted weather based on star movement (think of astrology) and current weather patterns, like a dew, cloud shapes, sky color, etc. So this block should be exposed to sky to work.

Maybe something like a crystal ball. Think of Remembrall from Harry Potter. When the ball is clear the weather will be clear, when it's cloudy there going to be bad weather (rain), and when it is cloudy and flashing - thunderstorm ahead. And this would also nicely fit in quazi-fantasy setting of Minecraft. The ball itself could be crafted from copper, amethyst shards and quartz (given that daylight detector also uses quartz).

It could also output redstone signal with strength based on type of upcoming weather (like 0 for clear, midrange for rain and 15 for thunderstorm) and, when used with comparator, signal strength would instead indicate time remaining for weather change - higher the signal strength, closer the change event.

It's a good idea, exept for one thing -- this is already possible. The music inside each music disc is saved inside a folder in your minecraft folder; all you have to do is change this music. Then you can use the command: /playsound minecraft:music_disc<disc name> player @a. This command will play the strad music disc to all players, regardless of where they are. It's a command I find myself using quite often. Thank you for the ffedback, however!

I think it would be good for the music to play in Just one large location that could be looped in that one area, as an example: you could make a carnival area and be able to hear carnival music just in the carnival, or you could make an aquarium and have aquarium themed music that can only be heard in the aquarium. (also I use bedrock audition on the switch so i don't really have access to commands)

one more thing, a lot of times I will use youtube on my phone as I play minecraft to listen to themed music that goes with whatever is happening in the game and I think it would be a great idea to be able to do it in game, also it would allow other players to here the themed music as well (if there in range of the speaker blocks).

Maybe the radio block could have access to all the different songs/music that are in the game, like the music from the main game, the mini games from console edition and all the music from the mash-up packs (of course the music from the super mario mash-up pack would only be usable on switch when not on cross console mode, but it would definitely help make my SM64 recreation better by having the right music play in the correct areas)

I came up with a recipe for the Speaker Block. 1 Note Block being surrounded with 8 Iron Nuggets. Also it should be made to where the Speaker Block can also amplify the sound of the music depending on how many are connected to the Radio Block or the Jukebox.
It sounds so cool but we already (sort of) have it with the jukebox

If you like the idea of making hoes more useful in Minecraft, please consider taking a look at this post I wrote some time ago. I feel like 5-9 wheat from a single plant is rather too much, especially seeing as how you can use Fortune to get more Wheat Seeds, which counteracts the other part of your idea.
Yeah, 5-9 wheat IS a bit much, but this is a great idea!

In my opinion farming sculc shriekers could be annoying for a casual player and their amount in a deep dark biome is quite limited. Instead I suggest that maybe the horn should have around 64 uses and only be repaired with echo shards (no mending). And then you could intorduce some cool way to farm the shards. I am thinking about beeing able to stun the warden for 1-2 seconds with the sound boom which makes it drop 1-3 shards out of its chest cavity, but enrages it immediatly afterwards challanging you to face and succesfully escape the warden which could be a cool especially if they make it even stronger.

This idea is great, and I hope an item like this gets added. Since other weapons deal more damage though, how about the Echo Horn deal less damage and more knockback. Maybe it could deal half a health bar of damage in exchange for as much knockback as the Warden's attack does?
the noise it could make could be a War Horn kinda thing overlayed over a skulk shrieker and I think it should have infinite ammo because echo shards and goat horns are already hard enough to collect
i think this is a great idea i also agree with the idea of having to use shards to repair it.

To get echo shards, you must get it from the chests which in turn comes from the ancient city. Because the ancient city is so rare, I propose to repair it (of course it would cost a lot to repair), to also make a way of gaining echo shards by combining sculk and amethyst shard (except you require a lot of amethyst shards and sculk to balance it due to players that might easily just repair it like nothing

i donb't think it needs a shrieker, maybe the shrieker enhance the damage. also, instead of durability, a more unique approach is to absorb xp to charge it up. the nummber you get is determined by xp and have a max of 100 xp. you an release a small sonic charge(5 xp), a medium one(20 xp) and a large one(100 xp). it will still have cooldown. in addition, you can add different goat horn/copper horn to it to get different sounds. the charges are based on how long you press and the sculk shrieker. at maximum(the damage is the same as the wardens) can be created using a medium with shrieker or a large one. in anvils, eacho shard can also add 20 xp to the horn. echo shard can be made by right clicking an amythst shard on a sculk block.

I personally feel like we should get more paintings in general- ones that better reflect the modern Minecraft feel. There should be more vibrant paintings, and perhaps paintings depicting each mob. Imagine a colorful, adorable painting of a flower field full of bees! Or a grim painting featuring blazes in the Nether.
The paintings we have now- I'll say it- are dull and boring! We need more color and variety!

More paintings that reference real-life paintings, minecraft, other games, and abstract paintings with no references to anything at all. Plus, they should add paintings that teach you how to play the game (like the wither painting that teaches you how to summon the wither).
For real! Decorating with the same few is getting so boring
They should bring back Kristoffer Zetterstrand to make more paintings. The paintings are extremely unique and one of a kind. Commissioning him to make some more would be really awesome.
I think we finally need some 3x3 or 3x2/2x3 paintings!! We don't have any yet and it's so frustrating when you have a blank wall but can't fit it with a painting!

There's an easy way to expand the paintings available without making significant changes to the way paintings work.  Instead of just adding more paintings to the list: add more lists.  The simplest way to implement is add a crafting recipe for each color of dye and a painting, which lets you select which library of paintings it uses when you place it.  Sort the paintings so that the dominant color matches the dye used to achieve it for intuition's sake.
More paintings could be made without Mojang spending much money on it by making a community event out of it.  A pixel art contest.  Winning entries get their piece put in the game and cape.
Different designs and different sizes!! Need some 1x3, 2x3 and so on.

When i build in Minecraft creative, i feel like all the paintings are repetitive so it would be nice to have a bigger variety of paintings to make the builds more unique after all, not every person in the real world has the same exact painting in their house, it would also be cool to make your own paintings but id be happy with a few new pictures being added.
That's a great idea, this should be in the game in 1.19 or 1.20.
I love it plus it would fit with archeology thats being added to 1.17

I suggested this once, although that was before copper existed and i suggested a pan that  you must sit there and hold like a fishing rod

 

either way I'd be happy to see it
this is great but the diamonds should be like .5% instead. 2% is kinda easy
lets go an actual good idea
Great idea. I'm super surprised this is not in Minecraft already.

I like this idea a lot. It would be a good compliment to fishing as well. My only concern is that (as you mentioned) iron and gold take 9 nuggets, yet at a rate of 8% for emerlad and 2% for diamond, these two are far too easy to get relative to the difficulty in getting a full ingot.

E.g. on average it would take 9/.15 = 60 trials to get 1 iron or gold ingot, while a diamond could be obtained in 1 / .02 = 50 trials. So diamond and emerald would end up being less rare in a sense... Also, I think gold should be a little more rare than iron to keep with the current ore rarity balance... maybe halve diamond and emerald to 4 and 1 percent then put iron up to 20%... or maybe put it to 17% and raise sand gravel and clay by 1%.

Balance aside I think this is a great idea!
great idea! maybe a scythe or shurikens!
Yes I respect your brainüíû
Not just pie, I want more food
Sweet berry, apple, chicken and beef pie. I would want these added in Minecraft.

Isn‚Äôt it a bit hard to create ? What would be the limit between Ship and NOT Ship ?

It‚Äôs obvious for us humans but for MINECRAFT it‚Äôs a real exercise.

When you complete this first challenge, you now need to consider the moving of the ship...

Let‚Äôs take an exemple: the Archimedes‚Äô Ships Addon by BalkondeurAlpha which actually works the same way.

With more than 1 thousand blocks, your game start lagging and textures are constantly popping...

Now with a vanilla style game, establishing a block number limit is pretty impossible so you‚Äôve just got a terribly lagging game. 

Next point. If you‚Äôve been playing MC for a bit, you might know that oceans are just like BIG puddles. Starting from this idea, we can easily deduce that most player won‚Äôt use that functionality considering it a waste...

So is it worth it to create a very complex system for absolutely NOTHING ?

(Id love to have your project in the game but I prefer to explain you why it wont be retained...see ya‚Äô ! )

It would be easy enough I think to Craft a steering wheel and place it on a wooden hull. This steering wheel could be able to move all wood planks and anything on top of them within 20 blocks. this would fix algorithm confusion and lag. I would also like to see the ability to put a sail on it to make it move faster. that may be a problem for lag depending on your device though. I personally lag just from moving inventory sometimes.
Maybe the lost enchantments could be ones from Minecraft Dungeons
Like gift or something you have a chance of getting a diamond or random good potion effect by killing a mob
I dont want archeology, it doesn't feel like minecraft and kinda would the minecraft vibe for me.

Another note: if we're adding a brush to the game, it should get the same treatment as any other new tool, and it needs to be more useful that just for the archeology part of the game.

  • If added, brushes should turn path blocks to dirt, grass to dirt, remove some of copper's corrosion, etc. Maybe using them on furry animals like cows, sheep, horses, dogs, etc. heals them.

They need to integrate better with the game and its mechanics, same as for shears or any other tool.
yeah i didnt really think the whole archeology thing fit that well. I thought the whole concept and everything surrounding it was weird. maybe in education edition but not minecraft.
Unpopular opinion from me i guess XD i like archeology especially since the brush texture will change to be more minecrafty
the old pottery shards would probably look better if they look like clay tablets (by this I mean that they would look better and also fit better into the game if they were more rectangular)
also maybe make teirs for the brushes

It appears there is either already an existing thread on this topic (or something very similar), it's a list of items/mobs/ideas, contains a previously rejected idea, is a bug or support issue, exists, or it is too general and is being removed by our team.  Please check out this link (https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360004442111-Creating-Great-Ideas), be sure to use search, and join existing threads in progress (we read ALL the comments). Thanks!
Thanks for bringing back the post in the right category :-)

Yes, I wholeheartedly agree. For me, when they were introducing archeology I was expecting something like new structures that would spawn partly buried under ground and you could dig around them to unearth the structure. With chests inside maybe the clay pot shards could be found only in those chest and that would be neat... But the way mojang presented archeology seemed(sorry mojang) quite awefull. To be honest first of all it looked like a cheesy mod, wich I understand appearence would change, and second of all the mechanics dont feel "Vanilla-y" at all. Im quite dissapointed with this feature and while certain parts of the feature could be cool if worked on, the other parts are just not very minecraft-like. I'm shure i'm not the only one that feels like this please help me think of more ideas to hopefully correct this new feature before it changes the minecraft we love in a negative way.

I guess wither is a type of poison...YES.

This has to be in!
It has to be added! My life depends on it
YES PLEASE!!!!  Make my BEES more important!!!
Maybe honey could be the primary ingredient for some other food with anti-withering properties.

Should it also cure slowness?  Maybe it just reduces the timer of all effects by 30 seconds instead of a straight up cure?  So, it will likely cure any harmful effect, at the expense of reducing positive effects.

Or maybe it cures 1 random effect?  Maybe a boon or a bane, at least they stack in case the wrong effect drops off, and still not as powerful as a bucket of milk.

this would give a reason to carry them (besides using them to craft honey) and would be a reliable mechanic besides carrying an ungodly amount of milk buckets

edit: honestly even if it didnt give you health or hunger when curing wither like it usually does (wither is sort of a "stronger" poison) I would be okay with that

I used to think, and still wholly believe that honey used to be a specialed milk that specifically targeted negative status effects. Im having a really hard time reconciling the fact it only cures poison lmao. I think it should keep all positive effects and remove all negative effects entirely, ty!
Not emerald.
For sure. It can make its durability stronger!
This would be a great addition. It is so so rare to find and it needs some other special buffs
Great idea! Gives the totem a purpose other than being consumed at death
Great idea! Gives the totem a purpose other than being consumed at death
Let's make Netherite, the first tier added in over 10 years, be made obsolete by a much more common, and easily craftable, material. Wait...
I like it but I feel netherite should still be the strongest with diamond being just below obsidian
Maybe obsidian armour should only be able to get crafted with a netherite stuff so it doesn‚Äôt make netherite obsolete
That would be WAY too OP considering how easy it is to get obsidian

I think we shouldn't have obsidian tools due to the fact that netherite was just added. Just the armour. It could give the effect of slowness II but also give fire resistance for 30 seconds once you get in lava. Sort of like the turtle helmet.
I also agree with PierciengPoet642. Obsidian is extremely easy to obtain. The crafting recipe would have to be different from other armours, or have a major disadvantage.

They should last longer and higher protection and when something provokes the armour it will bounce back there should be an obsidian pickaxe for stronger and faster mining and an obsidian sword for stronger weaponry and an obsidian axe for cutting wood faster and a obsidian as well as a obsidian hoe for faster and easier farming, obsidian armour for stronger protection (with shield), and obsidian shears for better wool farming.
